intro: Ceterachopsis paucivenosa, commonly known as the slender sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in dune environments. It is adapted to salt spray and can tolerate moderate drought conditions. Its unique morphology makes it an important component of coastal ecosystems.
